Patent Information.Patent Title: Anti-microbial Peptides And Methods Of Use Thereof
Patent Information.Abstract: Anti-microbial peptides and methods of use are provided.

Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide (FSAP) family. Temporin subfamily.
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.33321906] S. aureus ATCC 25923 biofilm:TG was capable of killing at least 39%, 78% and 87% at 3.12, 6.25, 12.5 and 25 µM.[Ref.22439858] Summary:TG had specific bactericidal activities against E. coli ATCC2592, M. luteus or S. cerevisiae.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.33321906]TG was shown to be harmless against human keratinocytes at all concentrations tested with a slight cytotoxicity (~20% reduction of metabolically-active cells) at the highest active concentration
Sequence Information.Function: Amphipathic alpha-helical antimicrobial peptide with activity against Gram-positive bacteria (M.luteus), Gram-negative bacteria (E.coli), and fungi (S.cerevisiae) (PubMed

Literature.Title: The Antimicrobial Peptide Temporin G Anti-Biofilm, Anti-Persister Activities, and Potentiator Effect of Tobramycin Efficacy Against Staphylococcus aureus.
Literature.Author: Casciaro B, Loffredo MR, Cappiello F, Fabiano G, Torrini L, Mangoni ML

Literature.Title: Temporins, antimicrobial peptides from the European red frog Rana temporaria.
Literature.Author: Mangoni M.L.,Miele R.,Canofeni S.,Mignogna G.,Simmaco M.
